abstracts.cdata!:
The Renewable Energy Small Power Project
            for Indonesia had two set of objectives: National and
            Global. The national objectives of the project were to: (i)
            facilitate private sector led development of small renewable
            power projects selling electricity to a State Electricity
            Corporation (PLN) grid on a commercially sustainable basis,
            within the framework of a least cost rural electrification
            strategy; (ii) promote environmentally sound energy resource
            development in Indonesia and reduce the energy sector's
            dependence on fossil fuels; and (iii) strengthen
            Indonesia's institutional capacity to sustain renewable
            energy development. The loan and grant agreements were
            signed on August 4, 1997. However, the project did not
            become effective as the financial and economic crisis that
            hit the country in 1997 caused the project to be no longer
            viable. Consequently, the loan and grant agreement were
            terminated on July 15, 1998, the effectiveness deadline.
